history.text: Hey, want to chat about a movie?
Yep, we're going to be talking about Maleficent
Have you seen it before? I really like Robert Stromberg's directing
Yes, I did actually with my friends. I personally thought it was a pretty good story portraying Maleficent side
I agree. I felt like Angeline Jolie did a wonderful job with that role!
But the ratings were average. 51% and 5.7 out of 10
I was thinking that too, surprising for as good of a movie as it was
It did receive a cinemascore of A
Which makes no sense haha. How are you going to give it half a rating but still get an A
Exactly, there has to be some consistency, right? I think that the critical response says a a lot, while it isn't perfect, as it says, it still manages to be improbably entertaining to watch...
But because of it's title character
Yes, that is true.
This is mean Angelina Jolie or Maleficent
I believe it was just because of Angelina Jolie playing the part
She saved the movie from being anything lower than the score that it was given
It really is! That has a lot to do with it.
I wonder if it would have been more well received had it been less loosely based on the original Sleeping Beauty, and been a little more true to the original.
Though, where it is supposed to depict the story from a new perspective, I suppose it can only be so true to the original...
Yes, I agree. I also thought Maleficent was suppose to be a witch. The key note says that she's a fairy

I agree with them though, that Maleficent absolutely wrecks the stereotypes that were mere
ly adjusted in Frozen.
Yes, that drove me crazy as well, that seems like too far of a stretch for me
I found it interesting that even though she disliked aurora initially, she cared for her when the pixies couldn't
I think it's because of her time with Stefan
She understands humans. I think during the time she fell for Stefan changed her views
True, stefan has a lot of influence on her...otherwise she wouldn't of turned the moors into a dark kingdom
Reading the whole key note, it was because Stefan betrayed her by ripping off her wings. But despite that, she still has a soft heart for humans
Yes, I just used that as a supporting reference to how her actions are influenced by Stefan, one way or the other. I agree
I liked how maleficent apologized to Aurora, that made my heart warm
What did they mean by demolishing stereotypes that were only tweaked in Frozen
Where there any stereotypes
I thought it was ridiculous that the wings are still "alive"
and flew back to Maleficent
Yes, that really drove me crazy...
I felt like it also should have taken Maleficent a little more effort and time to beat Stefan
well he is human in the end. he can't fly like she can
She does know magic
Yeah, I totally agree. Just the fact that she cannot bring herself to kill him in the end, you would think if would have taken more time for her to beat him with that hesitation and doubt
I feel bad for her yet I do understand Stefan feelings too
His father died but she was trying to protect Moor
Same here. I felt like that was pretty sad.
This drove their love apart, although I wonder if Stefan would have even liked her back

I feel like in the end, he wouldn't have, but I don't know. At the same time, he couldn't bring himself to
 drug her and kill her.
"Stefan taunts Maleficent, who is dizzy and sick from the iron, his former love for her fully gone, but before he can deliver a final blow, Aurora finds her wings and releases them."
I guess after many years pass since Aurora is what? 15?
I think so
Stefan just grew in hatred
It's only natural...
I feel like sharlto copely was one of the best picks for role with such duality
Or he could have let it be bygones. Stefan is still family. He knew what his father actions were. To take over moor
He really could have
In the end, I suppose it was Malificents call, where  she was the one to finally let go.
I think I see why it was given such a low score
There's so many ridiculous things on that were too simple and rushed
They should have at least show how Stefan came to his choices and hatred

Yeah, I suppose when you really look at it up close, and analyze the details, it really isn't worthy of the A. I think the other scores it was given more accurately reflect the work that it really is. I felt like we should've seen Stefan evolve more.
Yes, exactly, you said that last part better than I did
Yeah. It really explains critics about how it was pretty much saved because of Maleficient. I think what made it different was because people usually expected a guy and girl to kiss for "true love"
But what I think they did great at was showing how much love Maleficent had for Aurora that her kiss woke her up instead
Yeah, there is a lot to be said for taking the road less traveled.
It is said how they started out so innocent, with an attraction, and ended like this. Part of me always wants that happy fairy tale ending lol
Wait, is Aurora Stefan's daughter?
I didn't get that impression. But now I'm curious
Yes, she is. Well look at that. First it was Stefan, then it was Aurora
Well I'll be...
Isn't that something!

"After a brief reunion with his daughter, Stefan locks her away in a
 room for her own safety"
Wow Maleficent has her hands on this family
Yup, I somehow missed that! That is crazy!
I wonder how this all would have played out without Diaval.

Well at least this time it would be different. Aurora pretty much grew up with Maleficent. Although Maleficent only watched from afar, and showed herself when Aurora was 15, I don't think she would have any revenge thoughts
Yeah, I find it funny how convenient the raven was
Yeah, that is true...I don't think so either. And yes, a little too convenient loll
